channel.title: NYC Bakery: Celebrate Obama's inauguration with 'Drunken Nergro Head' cookies!
channel.description:
A bakery in New York City has caused some controversy as it capitalizes on President Barack Obama's inauguration. It has baked up some special cookies for customers that depict racist caricatures. Classy. The trendy Lafayette French Pastry Bakery in Greenwich Village — featured on TV's Sex and the City — is selling 'Drunken Negro Head' cookies — chocolate covered biscuits with huge red eyes, a bulbous nose and extra-large lips. The bakery owner, Ted Kefalinos, claims it's "just a fun face." But news reports say he's used the "N word" with customers when hawking the cookies and made vague, ominous hints of assassination, as the Daily Voice puts it: [i]"They're in honour of our new president," the baker reportedly told several patrons. "He's following in the same path of Abraham Lincoln. He will get what's coming to him."[/i] We thought the buttons and ball caps were appropriate souvenirs, when Kenny Yum went shopping here.
